All book bags/backpacks must be of the see-through variety (mesh or clear plastic) across all grade levels. A book bag/backpack is any container large enough to carry an average size textbook, including sacks, purses, bags, etc. Smaller purses and lunch boxes/bags do not have to be of the see-through variety. During the regular school hours, all bags used for extracurricular activities will be checked in upon arrival at school. School administration will provide specific instructions for these items. Please refer to the 2018-2019 handbook for additional updates.

Jasper takes over Class 6A top spot in high school volleyball rankings

Class 6A Jasper moved to No. 1 in this week’s AL.com’s high school volleyball rankings to mark the only change among top-ranked teams.

It’s the first No. 1 volleyball ranking in school history for the Vikings. Jasper (formerly Walker) reached as high as No. 2 in the 2014 September 4 rankings of Class 6A teams behind John Carroll and stayed there the following week, but has never been higher.

Jasper (31-2) ran off 30 straight wins to start the season before falling twice in the past week, losing to Daphne and Brewer, but the Vikings impressed with wins over Class 7A power and previously second-ranked Oak Mountain along with No. 10 Vestavia Hills and Enterprise.

It's a narrow margin between the top four in the class with defending champion Hazel Green, Spanish Fort, Daphne and Jasper all contenders for the title.

Jasper High 11th grade students can take the PSAT/NMSQT for free this year! The PSAT is the College Board National Merit Scholarship Qualifying Test and will be administered at Jasper High School on Wednesday, October 11th. Even though sophomores are not eligible to qualify for the scholarships, taking the test in Grade 10 can be preparation for the Grade 11 test. Tenth grade students will pay a registration fee of $16 to participate.

This is not a required test - but students who would like to participate in this testing opportunity, must do the following:

Register in the JHS Career Center with Mrs. Daniels before 11:30 a.m. each day. There is no registration fee for juniors (11th grade students). There is a $16 fee - paid with cash or check - for sophmores (10th grade students). ONLY the first 100 juniors and the first 25 sophmores to register will be tested. Registration closes at 3:30 p.m. on Tuesday, October 3rd.
